snippet: To deal with the tainted site, where Adam Lanza killed his mother two years ago before fatally shooting 26 others, officials are turning to an expert in troubled properties.
abstract: Hudson City Savings Bank hires real estate consultant Randall Bell, who specializes in troubled properties, for advice in dealing with empty house at 36 Yogananda Street in Newtown, Conn; house, which now belongs to town, is where Adam Lanza killed his mother before gunning down 26 others at Sandy Hook Elementary School in 2012; many residents would like to see house razed.
lead_paragraph: To deal with the tainted site, where Adam Lanza killed his mother two years ago before fatally shooting 26 others, officials are turning to an expert in troubled properties.

headline.main: Newtown Weighs What to Do With Adam Lanza’s Home
headline.print_headline: 2 Years Later, Newtown Weighs What to Do With a House Linked to a Killer
